metadata.title: CVE-2021-47173 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:misc/uss720: fix memory leak in uss720_probe uss720_probe forgets todecrease the refcount of usbdev in uss720_probe. Fix this by decreasing therefcount of usbdev by usb_put_dev. BUG: memory leak unreferenced object0xffff888101113800 (size 2048): comm "kworker/0:1", pid 7, jiffies4294956777 (age 28.870s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): ff ff ff ff 31 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 ....1........... 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 03 00 00 00 ................ backtrace: [<ffffffff82b8e822>] kmallocinclude/linux/slab.h:554 [inline] [<ffffffff82b8e822>] kzallocinclude/linux/slab.h:684 [inline] [<ffffffff82b8e822>]usb_alloc_dev+0x32/0x450 drivers/usb/core/usb.c:582 [<ffffffff82b98441>]hub_port_connect drivers/usb/core/hub.c:5129 [inline] [<ffffffff82b98441>]hub_port_connect_change drivers/usb/core/hub.c:5363 [inline][<ffffffff82b98441>] port_event drivers/usb/core/hub.c:5509 [inline][<ffffffff82b98441>] hub_event+0x1171/0x20c0 drivers/usb/core/hub.c:5591[<ffffffff81259229>] process_one_work+0x2c9/0x600 kernel/workqueue.c:2275[<ffffffff81259b19>] worker_thread+0x59/0x5d0 kernel/workqueue.c:2421[<ffffffff81261228>] kthread+0x178/0x1b0 kernel/kthread.c:292[<ffffffff8100227f>] ret_from_fork+0x1f/0x30 arch/x86/entry/entry_64.S:294

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.99').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.116').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1054.57~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1055.57~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1066.75').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1106.120').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gcp-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1049.53~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').
linux-gke-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.86').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1052.56~18.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1041.45~18.04.1').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2051.53').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2033.37').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2016.18').
